message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.CL, cs.CR

This paper discusses label smoothing, a common technique used in training deep learning models, and its effectiveness in coping with label noise. The paper focuses on the performance and calibration of the model, which are key concerns in machine learning, suggesting that it is likely to be categorized under cs.LG (Machine Learning). Additionally, the paper discusses the use of label smoothing in distilling models from noisy data, which could be categorized under cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). The paper also mentions the use of label smoothing in computer vision tasks, which could be categorized under cs.CV (Computer Vision) or cs.CL (Computation and Language). Finally, the paper discusses the impact of label noise on the model, which could be categorized under cs.CR (Cryptography and Security).
